column4: Hey! Is there any database for ubuntu users on getting the right nvidia drivers installed?
i thought nvidia-current sort of scanned and installed what it thought was needed.
detailas as to what happens exactly is more helpfull
the x gui to nvidia is 'nvidia-settings'
Yes, I get it open, but tells me  "You do not appear to be using the NVIDIA X driver. "
so... you are not using the nvidia drivers.
"Please edit your X configuration file (just run `nvidia-xconfig` as root), and restart the X server."
Well, I haven't... as I asked in the beginning, I wondered if there is a sound database webpage for getting the right driver installed
Hmm, well I guess I'll try that:) Brb
thats all ive ever needed to do for like all 10 of my nvidia machines.. ;)
Still no change with the nvidia-settings installed..
When I run it now it still tells me "You do not appear to be using the NVIDIA X driver."
'turns a second' ? you mean the RPM?
rootkits exist.. not really seen any active/live viruses for ubuntu/linux
I know, but might as well get it don't you think?:D
